title: Analysts say fuel subsidy removal may affect new vehicle sales [BTTV]
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The fuel subsidy rationalisation, which will start with diesel subsidy removal, may affect sales of both new vehicles especially diesel-powered pick-up trucks, industry analysts said.They believe while it will be business as usual for the affordable segment, ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The fuel subsidy rationalisation, which will start with diesel subsidy removal, may affect sales of both new vehicles especially diesel-powered pick-up trucks, industry analysts said.

They believe while it will be business as usual for the affordable segment, the fuel subsidy rationalisation will likely hurt the demand for mid-market models.

They also believe the subsidy rationalisation can shift the preference of car buyers.

title: IATA raises 2024 net profit forecast for airlines
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The International Air Transport Association (IATA) has upgraded its 2024 profitability projections for airlines to US$30.5bil in net profit compared to the US$25.7bil forecast made in December 2023.It said the improved profitability is also estimated to be ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The International Air Transport Association (IATA) has upgraded its 2024 profitability projections for airlines to US$30.5bil in net profit compared to the US$25.7bil forecast made in December 2023.

It said the improved profitability is also estimated to be higher than 2023’s US$27.4bil.

IATA said North America continues to be the most significant contributor to industry profits, supported by a high passenger load factor, robust yields and strong consumer

title: High expectations  for corporate earnings
summary: PETALING JAYA: Corporate Malaysia ended the first quarter of 2024 (1Q24) with a mixed bag of results that caused investors to offload local shares and drove the FBM KLCI to below 1,600 points.
content:
PETALING JAYA: Corporate Malaysia ended the first quarter of 2024 (1Q24) with a mixed bag of results that caused investors to offload local shares and drove the FBM KLCI to below 1,600 points.

The benchmark index of Bursa Malaysia fell by 1.4% to 1.596.68 points in the last week of May as the final lap of corporate earnings poured in and investors engaged in profit-taking.

The FBM Small Cap Index also declined by 2.4% in the same period to below the 19,000-point mark.<

content:
BNP Paribas SA Headquarters And Branches As France's Largest Bank Pledges Cost Cuts

At issue is the carbon emissions of buildings and the expected cost of upgrades needed to stay on the right side of new green regulations.

title: Maiden green bond attracts funds keen on curve building
summary: SYDNEY: Investors are welcoming Australia’s plans to build a sovereign green bond curve following its debut issuance this week, even as questions mount over the nation’s effort to cut carbon emissions.
content:
The Sydney Opera House and city centre skyline are seen in Sydney, Australia, February 28, 2020. REUTERS/Loren Elliott/File Photo

SYDNEY: Investors are welcoming Australia’s plans to build a sovereign green bond curve following its debut issuance this week, even as questions mount over the nation’s effort to cut carbon emissions.

summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The country’s latest tax reforms, outlined in Budget 2024 to stimulate domestic startups, drive clean energy investment and modernise tax administration, are set to benefit innovative startup businesses, green technology sectors and service-oriented companies.
content:

title: Solar power transforms life on Vietnam islands
summary: KHANH HOA (Vietnam): More than 30 locations in the Khanh Hoa Province’s Truong Sa Island District are now powered by clean energy, a feat that would not have been possible without the efforts of electricians who are working tirelessly to improve the lives of people here.

title: It’s a great time to be a Greek shipowner

title: Oil and gas companies to gain from increasing demand for crude
summary: PETALING JAYA: Crude oil prices are expected to remain high in the medium term, while national oil company Petroliam Nasional Bhd (PETRONAS) is anticipated to continue driving its domestic investments.
content:

title: EV sales defy China’s consumer spending slump
summary: SHANGHAI: Electric vehicles (EVs) remain a bright spot in China’s auto market as manufacturers of battery-powered cars overcame a slump in consumer spending at home thanks to price cuts and new model launches.
content:
Going strong: XPeng Inc EVs on display during an event in Hong Kong. The company saw sales growth of 35% for May in China. — Bloomberg

SHANGHAI: Electric vehicles (EVs) remain a bright spot in China’s auto market as manufacturers of battery-powered cars overcame a slump in consumer spending at home thanks to price cuts and new model launches.

The leading manufacturers, from BYD Co to Nio Inc, all reported strong sales growth in May. Seres Group C

title: Ellison’s latest Paramount offer has US$15 share sweetener
summary: WASHINGTON: Film producer David Ellison’s offer for Paramount Global includes an option for non-voting shareholders to cash out a portion of their stock for about US$15 a share, according to a person familiar with the matter.
content:
WASHINGTON: Film producer David Ellison’s offer for Paramount Global includes an option for non-voting shareholders to cash out a portion of their stock for about US$15 a share, according to a person familiar with the matter.

The offer, a roughly 26% premium to last Friday’s closing price, is for only some of the shares, according to the person, who asked to not be identified because the discussions aren’t public.

Spokespeople for Paramount and Ellison’s Skydance Media

title: Market poll: A Trump win is seen as a risk to Fed independence

title: PAS still fine-tuning list of potential candidates for Sungai Bakap by-election
summary: Penang PAS is currently fine-tuning the list of potential candidates for the Sungai Bakap state seat by-election before submitting it to the party leadership, says Penang PAS commissioner Muhammad Fauzi Yusoff.
content:
GEORGE TOWN (June 3): Penang PAS is currently fine-tuning the list of potential candidates for the Sungai Bakap state seat by-election before submitting it to the party leadership, says Penang PAS commissioner Muhammad Fauzi Yusoff.

He said although Penang PAS already had a list of potential candidates, they were still open to receiving input from all levels, including grassroots members.

title: India's Adani Group rallies on infrastructure bets as Modi seen retaining power
summary: BENGALURU: Shares of three Adani Group companies hit record highs Monday amid a broad-based rally in the infrastructure-focussed Indian conglomerate after exit polls predicted a third straight term for Prime Minister Narendra Modi's government.
content:
The Bombay Stock Exchange building in Mumbai, India. — Reuters

BENGALURU: Shares of three Adani Group companies hit record highs Monday amid a broad-based rally in the infrastructure-focused Indian conglomerate after exit polls predicted a third straight term for Prime Minister Narendra Modi's government.

The 10-company conglomerate, led by billionaire Gautam Adani, has invested billions of dollars in mining, ports, trading, electricity and gas among ot

title: GameStop soars as 'Roaring Kitty' reveals US$116mil bet in Reddit post
summary: GAMESTOP shares surged more than 70% premarket on Monday after "Roaring Kitty".
content:
A GameStop store is seen in the Jackson Heights neighborhood of New York City, New York, U.S. January 27, 2021. REUTERS/Nick Zieminski

GAMESTOP shares surged more than 70% premarket on Monday after "Roaring Kitty".

Keith Gill, the stocks influencer behind the 2021 retail trading frenzy, returned to Reddit with a post showing a $116 million bet on the embattled videogame retailer.

title: Politicians need to be honest about cost of achieving net zero; energy transition set to increase airfares — IATA DG
summary: Politicians globally are urged to be honest about the costs required to achieve net zero emissions — a common reference to offsetting greenhouse gas emissions from human activities — particularly in the aviation industry, where energy transition is set to result in higher airfares for consumers.
content:
DUBAI (June 3): Politicians globally are urged to be honest about the costs required to achieve net zero emissions — a common reference to offsetting greenhouse gas emissions from human activities — particularly in the aviation industry, where energy transition is set to result in higher airfares for consumers.

International Air Transport Association (IATA) director general Willie Walsh said sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) is at least three times more expensive than conventional jet kerosene, and mandating air

title: BMI: Malaysia’s latest tax reforms help stimulate innovation, local industries, advanced tech
summary: BMI said Malaysia’s latest tax reforms, outlined in Budget 2024, highlight the government's aim to stimulate domestic startups, drive clean energy investment and modernise tax administration.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (June 3): BMI said Malaysia’s latest tax reforms, outlined in Budget 2024, highlight the government's aim to stimulate domestic startups, drive clean energy investment and modernise tax administration.

In a note on May 31, BMI said innovative start-up businesses, green technology sectors and service-oriented companies are most likely to benefit from the recent changes.

On the other hand, sellers of low-value imported goods, and entities involved in

title: IATA: Global airlines to see revenue soaring close to RM4.7 trillion, net profits to RM143.6  billion
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The International Air Transport Association (IATA) has forecasted that the global airline industry will see revenue soaring close to RM4.7 trillion (US$1 trillion). Their net profits are expected to reach RM143.6 billion (US$30.5 billion) with a record high ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The International Air Transport Association (IATA) has forecasted that the global airline industry will see revenue soaring close to RM4.7 trillion (US$1 trillion). 

Their net profits are expected to reach RM143.6 billion (US$30.5 billion) with a record high of nearly five billion air travel passengers in 2024. 

The trade body's director general Willie Walsh said the 2024 net profits estimation would see an improvement from 2023 net profits which are projected to be RM129 billion (US$27.4 billion).

title: Stronger convenient store ops to fuel QL Resources' revenue: MIDF Research
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: QL Resources Bhd is expected to post steady revenue growth momentum backed by stronger performance from its convenient store (CVS) segment, according to MIDF Research. The firm said the company registered positive 12 month financial year 2024 (FY24) performances across ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: QL Resources Bhd is expected to post steady revenue growth momentum backed by stronger performance from its convenient store (CVS) segment, according to MIDF Research. 

The firm said the company registered positive 12 month financial year 2024 (FY24) performances across all segments with the CVS segment achieving billion-ringgit revenue.  

QL Resources reported FY24 core profit after tax and non-controlling interests of RM437.9 million, in line with its projections (102.3 per cent) and consensus' estima

title: IATA DG: 2023 the safest year for member airlines
summary: The International Air Transport Association (IATA) said it has concluded 2023 as the safest year for 336 member airlines, with the industry continuing to improve safety performance.
content:
DUBAI (June 3): The International Air Transport Association (IATA) said it has concluded 2023 as the safest year for 336 member airlines, with the industry continuing to improve safety performance.

“We never stand still [on safety]. That helped make 2023 our safest year by many parameters,” said IATA director general Willie Walsh at the association’s annual general meeting (AGM) on Monday.

Walsh said there were no fatal accidents among all IATA member airlines o

title: Najib’s RM6.6b IPIC trial to begin on Tuesday
summary: After the prosecution closed its 1Malaysia Development Bhd-Tanore (1MDB-Tanore) case last Friday (May 31), former prime minister Datuk Seri Najib Razak will be in court again on Tuesday (June 4), with former Treasury secretary general Tan Sri Mohd Irwan Serigar Abdullah, to face another trial.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (June 3): After the prosecution closed its 1Malaysia Development Bhd-Tanore (1MDB-Tanore) case last Friday (May 31), former prime minister Datuk Seri Najib Razak will be in court again on Tuesday (June 4), with former Treasury secretary general Tan Sri Mohd Irwan Serigar Abdullah, to face another trial.

This is in relation to six counts of criminal breach of trust (CBT) of over RM6.6 billion of government funds to International Petroleum Investment Co (IPIC).

title: The State of the Nation: ‘Cheap’ yen has greater impact on travellers than on trade
summary:
JAPAN appears to be one of the most popular countries to visit at the moment given how common it is to encounter someone who has either just returned from the Land of the Rising Sun or plans to visit soon.

Even for Malaysians who gripe about the ringgit being weak — albeit with good rea...
content:
This article first appeared in The Edge Malaysia Weekly on May 27, 2024 - June 2, 2024

JAPAN appears to be one of the most popular countries to visit at the moment given how common it is to encounter someone who has either just returned from the Land of the Rising Sun or plans to visit soon.

Even for Malaysians who gripe about the ringgit being weak — albeit with good reason — the Japanese yen has never been so “cheap”, at l

title: Cover Story: Creating a business ecosystem with synergistic effects
summary: Started as a hardware shop in Alor Setar, Kedah, in 1974, Chin Hin Group Bhd (KL:CHINHIN) now has myriad diversified companies related to the property business. It is now helmed by group managing director Chiau Haw Choon, who took over the business 18 years ago when his father, executive chairman...
content:
This article first appeared in City & Country, The Edge Malaysia Weekly on May 27, 2024 - June 2, 2024

Started as a hardware shop in Alor Setar, Kedah, in 1974, Chin Hin Group Bhd (KL:CHINHIN) now has myriad diversified companies related to the property business. It is now helmed by group managing director Chiau Haw Choon, who took over the business 18 years ago when his father, executive chairman Datuk Seri Chiau Beng Teik, became unwell.

title: Russian grocery retailer Svetofor gears up for Malaysian debut
summary: RUSSIA-based Svetofor Group, which operates a chain of grocers in Russia and across Europe is planning to make its entry into Malaysia, possibly its first Southeast Asian destination. The group, known for its hard discount stores/budget supermarkets, is understood to be awaiting the green light f...
content:
This article first appeared in The Edge Malaysia Weekly on May 27, 2024 - June 2, 2024

RUSSIA-based Svetofor Group, which operates a chain of grocers in Russia and across Europe is planning to make its entry into Malaysia, possibly its first Southeast Asian destination. The group, known for its hard discount stores/budget supermarkets, is understood to be awaiting the green light from the Ministry of Domestic Trade and Cost of Living to commence operations, sources say.

title: IATA: Global airline industry's net profit set to grow 11% in 2024 as revenue hits record high
summary: The International Air Transport Association (IATA) has raised its forecast for the global airline industry to record a net profit of US$30.5 billion (RM143.56 billion) in 2024, up from the US$25.7 billion estimate the association made in December last year.
content:
DUBAI (June 3): The International Air Transport Association (IATA) has raised its forecast for the global airline industry to record a net profit of US$30.5 billion (RM143.56 billion) in 2024, up from the US$25.7 billion estimate the association made in December last year.

The latest forecast translates to an 11% net profit growth for global airlines, from an estimated US$27.4 billion in 2023.

IATA’s director general Willie Walsh attributed the growth to continu

title: Microsoft to invest US$3.2bil in Swedish cloud, AI
summary: STOCKHOLM: Microsoft will invest 33.7 billion Swedish crowns ($3.21 billion) to expand its cloud and artificial intelligence infrastructure in Sweden over a two-year period, the U.S. tech group said on Monday.
content:
Microsoft logo is seen at the Mobile World Congress (MWC) in Barcelona, Spain February 27, 2024. REUTERS/Bruna Casas/File Photo

STOCKHOLM: Microsoft will invest 33.7 billion Swedish crowns ($3.21 billion) to expand its cloud and artificial intelligence infrastructure in Sweden over a two-year period, the U.S. tech group said on Monday.

The investment, Microsoft's biggest to date in Sweden, includes a pledge to help train some 250,000 people with AI skil

title: Nestle Malaysia brings joy to first batch of "Salary for Life" weekly winners
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Nestlé Malaysia Bhd recently unveiled its first list of weekly winners of a cash prize of RM3,500 each for its biggest contest to date, the "Peraduan Nestlé Gaji Seumur Hidup" or "Nestlé Salary for Life" contest.The nationwide ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Nestlé Malaysia Bhd recently unveiled its first list of weekly winners of a cash prize of RM3,500 each for its biggest contest to date, the "Peraduan Nestlé Gaji Seumur Hidup" or "Nestlé Salary for Life" contest.

The nationwide contest, which was launched in April to allow Malaysians to fulfil their dreams and earn a "salary for life", runs until June 30 this year with Nestlé Malaysia allocating a total of RM4 million.

title: Maybank IB raises FY2025-26 earnings forecasts for Dialog
summary: Maybank Investment Bank (Maybank IB) has raised its earnings forecasts by 20% for Dialog Group Bhd’s (KL:DIALOG) financial year 2025 (FY2025) and by 19% for FY2026, to reflect the renewal of its master service agreement by Petroliam Nasional Bhd (Petronas) and a turnaround in its downstream segment.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (June 3): Maybank Investment Bank (Maybank IB) has raised its earnings forecasts by 20% for Dialog Group Bhd’s (KL:DIALOG) financial year 2025 (FY2025) and by 19% for FY2026, to reflect the renewal of its master service agreement by Petroliam Nasional Bhd (Petronas) and a turnaround in its downstream segment.

content:

title: Former JP Morgan banker tasked to transform Affin Hwang Investment Bank
summary: IT is not easy to rattle Malaysia’s top investment banks, namely Malayan Banking Bhd and CIMB Bank Bhd, which have built their businesses on the back of the country’s rapid economic growth over the past decade. But, being small does not mean that a bank doesn’t have its own advantages at a time o...
content:
This article first appeared in Capital, The Edge Malaysia Weekly on May 27, 2024 - June 2, 2024

title: Black Swan Events, Geopolitics & Geoeconomics (Part 2)
summary: Geostrategy refers to the strategic management of a state's political, economic, and military resources to achieve its national interests within the context of global geopolitical dynamics. It involves the analysis and planning of how geographical factors, such as location, ...
content:
Geostrategy refers to the strategic management of a state's political, economic, and military resources to achieve its national interests within the context of global geopolitical dynamics.

It involves the analysis and planning of how geographical factors, such as location, natural resources, and physical terrain, influence a nation's security, alliances, and foreign policy decisions.

Geostrategy encompasses both defensive and offensive strategies, aiming to protect national sovereignty, enhance regional influ

title: Axiata's "Outperform" tag in tact after announcing plans to review edotco's recapitalisation.
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Kenanga Research has maintained its "Outperform" call on Axiata Group Bhd after the company announced plans to review Edotco's recapitalisation to achieve attractive valuations.The firm said Axiata believed that the global interest rate cycle has peaked, ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Kenanga Research has maintained its "Outperform" call on Axiata Group Bhd after the company announced plans to review Edotco's recapitalisation to achieve attractive valuations.

The firm said Axiata believed that the global interest rate cycle has peaked, which suggests stable or lower finance costs moving forward.

"Axiata's plans to recapitalise edotco are currently under review and reevaluation is largely due to unfavourable market conditions for tower infrastructure companies at this juncture.</

title: Global airlines raise profit outlook for 2024
summary: DUBAI: Global airlines on Monday raised their profit forecast for 2024 and projected industry-wide revenues just shy of $1 trillion as a record number of travellers board flights.
content:
DUBAI: Global airlines on Monday raised their profit forecast for 2024 and projected industry-wide revenues just shy of $1 trillion as a record number of travellers board flights.

The International Air Transport Association (IATA) said it expected the worldwide industry to generate $30.5 billion of profit this year, higher than an upwardly revised $27.4 billion in 2023 as carriers keep a lid on underlying labour costs despite recent strikes.

title: Feature: One of the largest asset managers seeks to democratise investing
summary:
Robo-advisory services, or digital investment managers (DIMs), are gaining further traction with the launch of Robo Investment Advisor (RIA) by Amanah Saham Nasional Bhd (ASNB). The aim of the service is to provide convenience, accessibility and affordability to investors.

A unique sell...
content:
This article first appeared in Wealth, The Edge Malaysia Weekly on May 27, 2024 - June 2, 2024

Robo-advisory services, or digital investment managers (DIMs), are gaining further traction with the launch of Robo Investment Advisor (RIA) by Amanah Saham Nasional Bhd (ASNB). The aim of the service is to provide convenience, accessibility and affordability to investors.

A unique selling point of RIA is that it comes with the low

title: After China, Zara expands live shopping experiment to Europe and US
summary: LONDON: Zara will expand its live shopping broadcasts to the UK, Europe and the United States this year, testing a format that is already wildly popular in China but one with which Western shoppers are less familiar.
content:
A logo of Zara is seen in Shanghai on Oct 13, 2022. [Photo/VCG]

LONDON: Zara will expand its live shopping broadcasts to the UK, Europe and the United States this year, testing a format that is already wildly popular in China but one with which Western shoppers are less familiar.

The fast-fashion brand, whose parent Inditex reports quarterly results on Wednesday, is investing in new ways to engage shoppers as analysts expect sales to grow less strongly

title: Indonesia's inflation rate cools in May, comes in below forecast
summary: JAKARTA: Indonesia's annual inflation rate eased more than expected in May, data from the statistics bureau showed on Monday, remaining within the central bank's 1.5% to 3.5% target range.
content:
A woman carries shopping bags after shopping for food at a market in Jakarta, Indonesia, Sunday, Aug 14, 2022. (AP Photo/Achmad Ibrahim)

JAKARTA: Indonesia's annual inflation rate eased more than expected in May, data from the statistics bureau showed on Monday, remaining within the central bank's 1.5% to 3.5% target range.

The May headline inflation rate was 2.84%, down from 3% in April. A Reuters poll of analysts had expected an inflation rate of 2.9

title: Zulkarnain is the new BPlant CEO? [BTTV]
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Former Pharmaniaga Bhd chief executive officer Datuk Zulkarnain Md Eusope will likely assume his new role as CEO of Boustead Plantations Bhd (BPlant) this week.Sources told Business Times that Zulkarnain may take office before BPlant's annual ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Former Pharmaniaga Bhd chief executive officer Datuk Zulkarnain Md Eusope will likely assume his new role as CEO of Boustead Plantations Bhd (BPlant) this week.

Sources told Business Times that Zulkarnain may take office before BPlant's annual general meeting on June 7.

title: Black Swan Events, Geopolitics & Geoeconomics
summary: Geostrategy refers to the strategic management of a state's political, economic, and military resources to achieve its national interests within the context of global geopolitical dynamics. It involves the analysis and planning of how geographical factors, such as location, ...
content: Geostrategy refers to the strategic management of a state's political, economic, and military resources to achieve its national interests within the context of global geopolitical dynamics. It involves the analysis and planning of how geographical factors, such as location, natural resources, and physical terrain, influence a nation's security, alliances, and foreign policy decisions. Geostrategy encompasses both defensive and offensive strategies, aiming to protect national sovereignty, enhance regional influence, and safe

title: AMD launches new AI chips to take on leader Nvidia
summary: TAIPEI: Advanced Micro Devices unveiled its latest artificial intelligence processors on Monday and detailed its plan to develop AI chips over the next two years in a bid to challenge industry leader Nvidia .
content:
FILE PHOTO: The logo of semiconductor company Advanced Micro Devices Inc (AMD) is seen on a graphics processing unit (GPU) chip in this illustration picture taken February 17, 2023. REUTERS/Florence Lo/Illustration/File photo

TAIPEI: Advanced Micro Devices unveiled its latest artificial intelligence processors on Monday and detailed its plan to develop AI chips over the next two years in a bid to challenge industry leader Nvidia .

title: Avanade names Bhavya Kapoor as area president of growth markets
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Avanade, one of Microsoft Corporation's leading solutions providers, has today announced the appointment of Bhavya Kapoor as its area president for growth markets.Bhavya takes the reins from Rodrigo De Queiroz Caserta, who assumes a new role ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Avanade, one of Microsoft Corporation's leading solutions providers, has today announced the appointment of Bhavya Kapoor as its area president for growth markets.

Bhavya takes the reins from Rodrigo De Queiroz Caserta, who assumes a new role as Avanade's global technology business group lead.

Both appointments are effective from June 1 this year, the company said in a statement.

The development follows on the heels of Avanade having unveiled its first generative artificial intelligence (AI)

title: Malaysia's tax reforms help stimulate innovation, advanced technologies - BMI
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia’s latest tax reforms, outlined in the Budget 2024 to stimulate domestic startups, drive clean energy investment, and modernise tax administration, are set to benefit innovative startup businesses, green technology sectors, and service-oriented companies.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia’s latest tax reforms, outlined in the Budget 2024 to stimulate domestic startups, drive clean energy investment, and modernise tax administration, are set to benefit innovative startup businesses, green technology sectors, and service-oriented companies.

BMI, a Fitch solutions company, said the budget’s sweeping tax reforms aimed to stimulate local industries and channel investment into key sectors, including advanced manufacturing.

title: Secret Recipe, Bayu Somerset team up to unveil traditional Malay outfits inspired by cakes
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Secret Recipe has collaborated with local clothing brand Bayu Somerset to introduce a collection of traditional Malay outfits inspired by the former's cake collection.The Bayu Somerset x Secret Recipe collection features an enticing array of clothing ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Secret Recipe has collaborated with local clothing brand Bayu Somerset to introduce a collection of traditional Malay outfits inspired by the former's cake collection.

The Bayu Somerset x Secret Recipe collection features an enticing array of clothing and accessories. 

Each piece echoes Secret Recipe's iconic cakes and perfectly matches the cute, bright and vibrant look for which Bayu Somerset is renowned. 

"Our collaboration with Bayu Somerset is a harmonious blend of elegance and taste, sho

title: Nvidia unveils roadmap for new semiconductors, reveals new Rubin platform
summary: TAIPEI: Global technology giant Nvidia Corporation revealed its latest roadmap for new semiconductors that will arrive on a ‘one-year rhythm’.
content:
FILE PHOTO: A smartphone with a displayed NVIDIA logo is placed on a computer motherboard in this illustration taken March 6, 2023. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration/File Photo

TAIPEI: Global technology giant Nvidia Corporation revealed its latest roadmap for new semiconductors that will arrive on a ‘one-year rhythm’.

It revealed, for the first time, the Rubin platform slated for a 2026 release, which will succeed its recently launched Blackwell platform.

title: Anwar congratulates King on his birthday
summary: Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim has extended his highest congratulations to His Majesty Sultan Ibrahim, King of Malaysia, in conjunction with Sultan Ibrahim's official birthday on Monday.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (June 3): Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim has extended his highest congratulations to His Majesty Sultan Ibrahim, King of Malaysia, in conjunction with Sultan Ibrahim's official birthday on Monday.

Anwar, on behalf of the unity government, prayed that the King, Queen and the entire royal family remain blessed with good health, prosperity and sovereignty.

“May His Majesty remain steadfast to ruling fairly and equitably as the country’s head o

title: Interlude: Apps that are worth trying in 2024
summary: It is exciting to see more digital wealth and investment solutions in the market these days. The more interesting ones include stock trading app Moomoo and the GXBank app. Meanwhile, Versa, with its clean and intuitive interface, is another worthy option.
content:
This article first appeared in Wealth, The Edge Malaysia Weekly on May 27, 2024 - June 2, 2024

It is exciting to see more digital wealth and investment solutions in the market these days. The more interesting ones include stock trading app Moomoo and the GXBank app. Meanwhile, Versa, with its clean and intuitive interface, is another worthy option.

title: Customs' enhanced enforcement leads to 20pct more illegal cigarettes seized: MİG president
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The Customs Department's anti-corruption and enhanced enforcement have led to over 20 per cent increase in the number of illegal cigarettes seized and confiscated for the first quarter of 2024 compared to the same period in 2023.Malaysia Integrity and ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The Customs Department's anti-corruption and enhanced enforcement have led to over 20 per cent increase in the number of illegal cigarettes seized and confiscated for the first quarter of 2024 compared to the same period in 2023.

Malaysia Integrity and Governance Society (MIG) president Datuk Seri Akhbar Satar said illegal cigarette prevalence in Malaysia had seen an improvement from 56.4 per cent in January 2024 to 55.4 per cent in March 2024 based on Nielsen's illicit cigarette study.

Akhbar said

title: Malaysian franchisors secure RM54mil potential sales from INSP
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysian franchisors in the International Sourcing Programme (INSP) in conjunction with the recent 31st International Franchise Exhibition and Conference 2024 (FIM 2024) have clinched potential sales of RM54 million (US$11.22 million).The Malaysia External Trade Development Corporation (Matrade) chief executive ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysian franchisors in the International Sourcing Programme (INSP) in conjunction with the recent 31st International Franchise Exhibition and Conference 2024 (FIM 2024) have clinched potential sales of RM54 million (US$11.22 million).

The Malaysia External Trade Development Corporation (Matrade) chief executive officer Datuk Mohd Mustafa Abdul Aziz said the outcomes reflect the confidence that the foreign franchisees have on Malaysia franchisors.

title: China's factory activity growth hits 2-year high, Caixin PMI shows
summary: BEIJING: China's manufacturing activity in May grew at the fastest pace in about two years with strong production and new orders, a private sector survey showed on Monday, indicating the sector remains robust amid supportive industrial policies.
content:
BEIJING: China's manufacturing activity in May grew at the fastest pace in about two years with strong production and new orders, a private sector survey showed on Monday, indicating the sector remains robust amid supportive industrial policies.

The Caixin/S&P Global manufacturing PMI rose to 51.7 in May from 51.4 the previous month, marking the fastest pace since June 2022 and beating analysts' forecasts of 51.5. The 50-point mark separates growth from contraction.

<

title: Oil prices slip despite Opec+ production cut extension
summary: SINGAPORE: Oil prices fell early on Monday, despite a move by producer group OPEC+ to extend deep output cuts well into 2025.
content:
FILE PHOTO: A 3D-printed oil pump jack is seen in front of displayed OPEC logo in this illustration picture. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic

SINGAPORE: Oil prices fell early on Monday, despite a move by producer group OPEC+ to extend deep output cuts well into 2025.

Brent futures for August delivery were down 24 cents, or 0.3%, to $80.87 a barrel at 0030 GMT.

U.S. West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude futures for July delivery fell 19 cents, or 0.25%, to $76.80.

title: Japan's May factory activity expands for first time in a year, PMI shows
summary: TOKYO: Japan's factory activity expanded for the first time in a year in May, a private-sector survey showed on Monday, but overall growth was modest and demand was still subdued while a weak yen raised the cost of imported items for some producers.
content:
TOKYO: Japan's factory activity expanded for the first time in a year in May, a private-sector survey showed on Monday, but overall growth was modest and demand was still subdued while a weak yen raised the cost of imported items for some producers.

The final au Jibun Bank Japan manufacturing purchasing managers' index (PMI) rose to 50.4 last month from 49.6 in April, having last climbed above the 50.0 threshold - which separates growth from contraction in activity - in May

title: Asia shares rally on hopes for more rate cuts this week
summary: SYDNEY: Asian share markets rose on Monday as investors looked forward to a rate cut in Europe, and quite possibly Canada, as the next step in global policy easing, though sticky inflation threatens to make the process a drawn out affair.
content:
SYDNEY: Asian share markets rose on Monday as investors looked forward to a rate cut in Europe, and quite possibly Canada, as the next step in global policy easing, though sticky inflation threatens to make the process a drawn out affair.

The European Central Bank (ECB) is considered almost certain to trim rates by a quarter point to 3.75% on Thursday, the first time in history it would have eased ahead of the U.S. Federal Reserve.

However, a surprisingly high reading

summary: Sime Darby Property’s strong emphasis on urban biodiversity highlights its dedication to implementing nature-based solutions to enhance flora and fauna. These efforts are crucial for community resilience, safeguarding future communities and ecosystems, and enriching the quality of life for all. As a proponent of urban biodiversity, the Group is committed to preserving, regenerating, and strengthening healthy ecosystems across its townships and developments.

title: Ringgit to remain in tight range versus US dollar
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The ringgit is likely to remain in range-bound trading against the US dollar this week as markets further digest the global economic outlook, says an analyst.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The ringgit is likely to remain in range-bound trading against the US dollar this week as markets further digest the global economic outlook, says an analyst.

Bank Muamalat Malaysia Bhd chief economist Dr Mohd Afzanizam Abdul Rashid said the local currency would likely linger in a narrow range of around 4.7000 after appreciating in the previous week.

He said the market’s focus started to shift to the upcoming Federal Open Market Committee meeting, which i

title: Japan’s services sector to raise investments
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Japanese companies in the services sector in Malaysia are expected to increase investments here.
content:
Jetro

KUALA LUMPUR: Japanese companies in the services sector in Malaysia are expected to increase investments here.

Managing director of Japan External Trade Organisation (Jetro) Kuala Lumpur, Koichi Takano, said Japanese restaurants are making forays here while some legal firms are jointly opening branches with Malaysian partners.

title: FBM KLCI likely to face downward pressure
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Bursa Malaysia is expected to face continued downward pressure this week as investors remain cautious, focusing on defensive sectors and avoiding risky investments.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Bursa Malaysia is expected to face continued downward pressure this week as investors remain cautious, focusing on defensive sectors and avoiding risky investments.

Maybank Investment Bank Bhd chartist Nik Ihsan Raja Abdullah said the FBM KLCI may struggle to find an upward momentum unless there are unexpected positive developments in global or local economic data.“Based on the recent global market developments, the benchmark index is expected to face a

title: Autodesk board replaces CFO after investigation
summary: NEW YORK: Autodesk Inc reassigned its chief financial officer (CFO) after an internal investigation into accounting practices delayed financial filings for weeks.
content:
NEW YORK: Autodesk Inc reassigned its chief financial officer (CFO) after an internal investigation into accounting practices delayed financial filings for weeks.

Deborah Clifford, who has been CFO since March 2021, will become chief strategy officer, effective immediately, the company said last Friday in a statement.

Elizabeth Rafael, an Autodesk board member, was appointed interim CFO and remains on the board.

The decision to replace Clifford as CFO was made by

title: Malaysia’s Islamic finance ecosystem set to attract more investments
summary: KANGAR: The growing Islamic financial ecosystem in Malaysia has the potential to attract more investments, not only from Islamic countries but also from investors who prioritise ethical principles and social responsibility.
content:
KANGAR: The growing Islamic financial ecosystem in Malaysia has the potential to attract more investments, not only from Islamic countries but also from investors who prioritise ethical principles and social responsibility.

Associate Prof Dr Mohd Zukime Mat Junoh, senior lecturer at the Faculty of Business and Communication, Universiti Malaysia Perlis, said that one of the attractions of the Islamic financial system is its adherence to syariah requirements, transparency, and

title: Laurentian bucks bank trend by slashing Toronto office space
summary: TORONTO: Laurentian Bank of Canada is slashing its Toronto office space by two-thirds as it leans into a hybrid work model and seeks cost savings amid a broader strategic revamp.
content:
TORONTO: Laurentian Bank of Canada is slashing its Toronto office space by two-thirds as it leans into a hybrid work model and seeks cost savings amid a broader strategic revamp.

The lender recorded charges of C$13.2mil in the fiscal second quarter “mainly related to the impairment of its premises,” the company said in a statement last Friday.

The reductions wouldn’t affect Laurentian’s Montreal headquarters, corporate offices in Burlington, Ontario, or network of reta

title: Rise in credit card and other unsecured debt in Singapore
summary: SINGAPORE: Credit card billings continued to stay above the S$20bil mark in the first quarter of 2024, although there was a slight fall of about 5% from the high of S$24.3bil in the previous quarter.
content:
SINGAPORE: Credit card billings continued to stay above the S$20bil mark in the first quarter of 2024, although there was a slight fall of about 5% from the high of S$24.3bil in the previous quarter.

The billings first crossed S$20bil in the third quarter of 2022.

The latest amount of S$23.1bil may have been a dip from the previous quarter, but credit card rollover balance and bad debts written off have risen, according to the credit and charge card statistics from the

title: South Korea’s chip exports lead trade gains supporting economy
summary: SEOUL: South Korea’s export growth continued last month, led by demand for semiconductors, supporting optimism among policymakers for a better-than-expected economic expansion this year.
content:
Renewed optimism: Samsung Electronics reports better-than-expected earnings as demand for its memory chips recovers. — Bloomberg

SEOUL: South Korea’s export growth continued last month, led by demand for semiconductors, supporting optimism among policymakers for a better-than-expected economic expansion this year.

title: Gap’s red carpet pivot is a hit with shoppers
summary: NEW YORK: Wall Street likes what Gap Inc is selling.
content:
On the mend: Gap’s flagship store in Shanghai, China. The company’s recent earnings provide evidence of a textbook retail recovery as sales improved and margins expanded. — Bloomberg

NEW YORK: Wall Street likes what Gap Inc is selling.

The retailer’s shares jumped more than 28% last Friday – the most since November 2023 – following an eye-popping earnings report that showed a fashion overhaul by new chief executive officer Richard Dickso

title: Bankers brace for IPO surge as elections end
summary: New Delhi: India has turned into Asia’s hottest market for share sales including initial public offerings (IPOs), and as elections come to a close, a bumper crop of deals is poised to set a record as investors seek to tap the rapid growth in the region’s third-largest economy.
content:
Growth engine: Steel being forged in a factory in Hooghly, India. Activity in the equity market is expected to rise sharply now that the country’s elections are over. — Reuters

title: Household spending going strong
summary: PETALING JAYA: Domestic consumer spending, a key economic driver, is expected to maintain resilience amid higher inflationary pressure and challenges.
content:
OCBC Bank senior Asean economist Lavanya Venkateswaran

PETALING JAYA: Domestic consumer spending, a key economic driver, is expected to maintain resilience amid higher inflationary pressure and challenges.

Economists are projecting household spending to expand by 4% to 5% this year, which is a commendable growth although lower than the pre-Covid-19 pandemic growth rate of 7%.

However, economists and analysts concurred that the consumer spending t

title: Challenges remain in stablising gold market in Vietnam
summary: HANOI: After nine gold auctions, the State Bank of Vietnam (SBV) will no longer be using the measure to try and stabilise the market but instead introduce other administrative tools next week, says the central bank’s head.
content:
HANOI: After nine gold auctions, the State Bank of Vietnam (SBV) will no longer be using the measure to try and stabilise the market but instead introduce other administrative tools next week, says the central bank’s head.

The goal is to reduce the gap between domestic and global gold prices, as well as to increase transparency in gold-market transactions.

Speaking at the socio-economic discussion session on May 29, Nguyen Thi Hong, the governor of the SBV, said that r

title: China and US aim to tackle climate issues
summary: SAN FRANCISCO: Officials from the United States and China gathered last Wednesday in Berkeley, California, putting aside national tensions to focus on a shared challenge: climate change.
content:
FILE -- California Gov. Gavin Newsom speaks during a news conference in Sacramento, California, on May 10, 2024. Newsom signed a law on Thursday, May 23, 2024, temporarily allowing Arizona doctors come to California to perform abortions. (AP Photo/Rich Pedroncelli,File)

title: Over 30% of Vietnamese consumers keen on EVs
summary: HANOI: More than 30% of Vietnamese consumers are interested in purchasing electric vehicles (EVs), according to a recent global automotive consumer study from Deloitte.
content:
VinFast Auto Ltd. electric vehicle VF e34 models at a charging station outside a company's showroom in Hanoi, Vietnam. - Bloomberg

HANOI: More than 30% of Vietnamese consumers are interested in purchasing electric vehicles (EVs), according to a recent global automotive consumer study from Deloitte.

The main drivers for the interest are reduced operating costs, climate-change concerns, and personal health benefits. Driving experience is also an im
